XmlExample - Class in template.xml
An example for writing and reading XML, copy, modify and divide this class according it to your needs.
It uses three different inner class data objects (one containing another and a wrapped HashMap) to demonstrate the features of the template.xml packages.
Reading back needs a handler for the XML tags, this example uses org.xml.sax.ext.DefaultHandler2.
A real world implementation would not do all the stuff with inner classes, this is just for demonstration.
XmlExample() - Constructor for class template.xml.XmlExample
Construction, write and XML file from two objects and a wrapped HashMap and read it back.
XmlExample.ObjectA - Class in template.xml
Container for an int, a String and ObjectB
XmlExample.ObjectB - Class in template.xml
Container for an int and a String
XmlExample.State - Enum in template.xml
 
XmlExample.XmlReadHandler - Class in template.xml
A handler to read in the XML file just written.
XmlExample.XmlWrappedHashMap - Class in template.xml
A wrapped HashMap to write it to a XML file, we can also wrap collections or other objects
xmlHashMap - Variable in class template.xml.XmlExample.XmlReadHandler
 
XmlReadHandler(XmlExample) - Constructor for class template.xml.XmlExample.XmlReadHandler
 
XmlWrappedHashMap() - Constructor for class template.xml.XmlExample.XmlWrappedHashMap
 
XmlWritable - Interface in template.xml
An interface an object may implement to make it writable to XML using XmlWriter.
XmlWriter - Class in template.xml
Writes data (usually of an object) to a XML file.
XmlWriter(String, boolean) - Constructor for class template.xml.XmlWriter
Instantiates a new xml writer to make something persistent.
XmlWriter(String, String, boolean) - Constructor for class template.xml.XmlWriter
Instantiates a new xml writer to make something persistent.
